items.label: assump-regime-validity
items.title: Regime of Validity for Wasserstein-2 Contraction
items.content:
2530: :label: assump-regime-validity
2531: 
2532: 1. **Separation Requirement**: $L = \|\bar{x}_1 - \bar{x}_2\| > L_0(\delta, \varepsilon)$
2533:    - Physical meaning: Swarms must be sufficiently separated for geometric partition to work
2534:    - Typical value: $L_0 \sim 100$ for $d=10$, $\delta=0.1$
2535: 
2536: 2. **Confining Potential** (Axiom 2.1.1):
2537:    $$
2538:    U(x) \to +\infty \text{ as } \|x\| \to \infty
2539:    $$
2540:    - Ensures swarms don't escape to infinity
2541:    - Guarantees fitness valley exists between local maxima
2542: 
2543: 3. **Environmental Richness** (Axiom 4.1.1):
2544:    $$
2545:    \exists x_{\text{valley}} \in [\bar{x}_1, \bar{x}_2]: \quad F(x_{\text{valley}}) < \min(F(\bar{x}_1), F(\bar{x}_2)) - \Delta_{\text{valley}}
2546:    $$
2547:    - Ensures separated swarms are at distinct fitness peaks
2548:    - Required for outlier alignment mechanism
2549: 
2550: 4. **Bounded Virtual Rewards** (Axiom 1.2):
2551:    $$
2552:    \|V_{\text{fit},k,i} - V_{\text{fit},k,j}\| \leq \Delta V_{\max}
2553:    $$
2554:    - Ensures minimum survival probability $p_u > 0$
2555:    - Required for N-uniformity
2556: 
2557: 5. **Small Noise Regime**: $\delta \ll L$
2558:    - Ensures Case A expansion $\varepsilon_A = O(\delta^2/L^2)$ is negligible
2559:    - Typical: $\delta/L < 0.01$
2560: 
2561: 6. **Moderate Exploitation**: $\beta = O(1)$
2562:    - Too small: No fitness-based selection (no cloning advantage)
